result.execSummary:
All charges against Andrew M Long in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew M Long is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew M Long

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew M Long in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Andrew M Long.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense moves the Court to dismiss, complaint does not state probable cause. Court grants defenses motion and orders case DISMISSED without prejudice.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022

Defendant Andrew M Long in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Counsel unable to appear, but informed the court prior to calling the case.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with OM.

Defendant Andrew M Long in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8/8/22 @ 1p
